page.title: 15THE CATTLE MART 1/2
page.content:
The cattle market (mart) in Tow Law has been in existence since 1882, when it was founded by Joseph Vickers, a local farmer.
Since then four generations of the Vicars' family have run the mart; the present Managing Director is Mr Harry Vicars.
The sales,mainly of cattle and sheep, are held fortnightly, especially during Spring and Autumn.
Farmers from miles around attend the sales either to sell, buy or just keep in touch with the latest prices and with friends.
The order of sale is decided by "lot" as a good or bad turn can make a big difference to the farmer's profits.
